verses.verse: To the chief <S%H5329>Musician<s%> on <S%H5058>Neginoth,<s%> <S%H4905>Maschil,<s%> A Psalm of <S%H1732>David.<s%> Give <S%H238>ear<s%> to my <S%H8605>prayer,<s%> O <S%H430>God;<s%> and hide not <S%H408>thyself<s%> <S%H5956><s%> from my <S%H4480>supplication.<s%> <S%H8467><s%>
Attend <S%H7181><s%> unto me, and <S%H6030>hear<s%> me: I <S%H7300>mourn<s%> in my <S%H7879>complaint,<s%> and make a <S%H1949>noise;<s%>

Because of the <S%H4480>voice<s%> <S%H6963><s%> of the <S%H341>enemy,<s%> <S%H4480>because<s%> <S%H6440><s%> of the <S%H6125>oppression<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> they <S%H4131>cast<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> me, and in <S%H639>wrath<s%> they <S%H7852>hate<s%> me.
My <S%H3820>heart<s%> is sore <S%H2342>pained<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> me: and the <S%H367>terrors<s%> of <S%H4194>death<s%> are <S%H5307>fallen<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> me.
Fearfulness <S%H3374><s%> and <S%H7461>trembling<s%> are <S%H935>come<s%> upon me, and <S%H6427>horror<s%> hath <S%H3680>overwhelmed<s%> me.
And I <S%H559>said,<s%> Oh <S%H4310>that<s%> I <S%H5414>had<s%> <S%H83>wings<s%> like a <S%H3123>dove!<s%> for then would I fly <S%H5774>away,<s%> and be at <S%H7931>rest.<s%>
Lo, <S%H2009><s%> then would I <S%H5074>wander<s%> far <S%H7368>off,<s%> and <S%H3885>remain<s%> in the <S%H4057>wilderness.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>
I would <S%H2363>hasten<s%> my <S%H4655>escape<s%> from the <S%H4480>windy<s%> <S%H7307><s%> <S%H5584>storm<s%> and <S%H4480>tempest.<s%> <S%H5591><s%>

Destroy, <S%H1104><s%> O <S%H136>Lord,<s%> and <S%H6385>divide<s%> their <S%H3956>tongues:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H2555>violence<s%> and <S%H7379>strife<s%> in the <S%H5892>city.<s%>

Day <S%H3119><s%> and <S%H3915>night<s%> they go <S%H5437>about<s%> it <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H2346>walls<s%> thereof: <S%H205>mischief<s%> also and <S%H5999>sorrow<s%> are in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> of it.
Wickedness <S%H1942><s%> is in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> thereof: <S%H8496>deceit<s%> and <S%H4820>guile<s%> <S%H4185>depart<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> her <S%H7339>streets.<s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> it was <S%H3808>not<s%> an <S%H341>enemy<s%> that <S%H2778>reproached<s%> me; then I could have <S%H5375>borne<s%> it: <S%H3808>neither<s%> was it he that <S%H8130>hated<s%> me that did <S%H1431>magnify<s%> himself <S%H5921>against<s%> me; then I would have hid <S%H5641>myself<s%> <S%H4480>from<s%> him:
But it was <S%H859>thou,<s%> a <S%H582>man<s%> mine <S%H6187>equal,<s%> my <S%H441>guide,<s%> and mine <S%H3045>acquaintance.<s%>
We took <S%H4985>sweet<s%> <S%H5475>counsel<s%> <S%H3162>together,<s%> and <S%H1980>walked<s%> unto the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%> in <S%H7285>company.<s%>

Let <S%H4194>death<s%> <S%H5377>seize<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> them, and let them go <S%H3381>down<s%> <S%H2416>quick<s%> into <S%H7585>hell:<s%> <S%H3588>for<s%> <S%H7451>wickedness<s%> is in their <S%H4033>dwellings,<s%> and <S%H7130>among<s%> them.
As for me, <S%H589>I<s%> will <S%H7121>call<s%> <S%H413>upon<s%> <S%H430>God;<s%> and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> shall <S%H3467>save<s%> me.
Evening, <S%H6153><s%> and <S%H1242>morning,<s%> and at <S%H6672>noon,<s%> will I <S%H7878>pray,<s%> and cry <S%H1993>aloud:<s%> and he shall <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H6963>voice.<s%>

He hath <S%H6299>delivered<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> in <S%H7965>peace<s%> from the <S%H4480>battle<s%> <S%H7128><s%> that was against me: <S%H3588>for<s%> there <S%H1961>were<s%> <S%H7227>many<s%> <S%H5978>with<s%> me.

God <S%H410><s%> shall <S%H8085>hear,<s%> and <S%H6031>afflict<s%> them, even he that <S%H3427>abideth<s%> of <S%H6924>old.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%> <S%H834>Because<s%> they have <S%H369>no<s%> <S%H2487>changes,<s%> therefore they <S%H3372>fear<s%> <S%H3808>not<s%> <S%H430>God.<s%>
He hath put <S%H7971>forth<s%> his <S%H3027>hands<s%> against such as be at <S%H7965>peace<s%> with him: he hath <S%H2490>broken<s%> his <S%H1285>covenant.<s%>

The words of his <S%H6310>mouth<s%> were <S%H2505>smoother<s%> than <S%H4260>butter,<s%> but <S%H7128>war<s%> was in his <S%H3820>heart:<s%> his <S%H1697>words<s%> were <S%H7401>softer<s%> than <S%H4480>oil,<s%> <S%H8081><s%> yet were <S%H1992>they<s%> drawn <S%H6609>swords.<s%>

Cast <S%H7993><s%> thy <S%H3053>burden<s%> <S%H5921>upon<s%> the <S%H3068>LORD,<s%> and <S%H1931>he<s%> shall <S%H3557>sustain<s%> thee: he shall <S%H3808>never<s%> <S%H5769><s%> <S%H5414>suffer<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> to be <S%H4131>moved.<s%>

But <S%H859>thou,<s%> O <S%H430>God,<s%> shalt bring them <S%H3381>down<s%> into the <S%H875>pit<s%> of <S%H7845>destruction:<s%> <S%H1818>bloody<s%> and <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> <S%H376>men<s%> shall <S%H3808>not<s%> live out <S%H2673>half<s%> their <S%H3117>days;<s%> but <S%H589>I<s%> will <S%H982>trust<s%> in thee.
